titleStmt.title: Antisacrilegus: or, A defensative against the plausible pest, or guilded poyson, of that nameless paper, (supposed to be the plot of Dr. C. Burges, and his partners;) which tempts the Kings Majestie by the offer of five hundred thousand pounds, to make good by an Act of Parliament to the purchasers of bishops, deans, and chapters lands, their illegal bargain, for ninety nine years. By John Gauden, D.D. chaplain in ordinary to the Kings most excellent Majesty.
titleStmt.author: Gauden, John, 1605-1662.

titleStmt.title: Antisacrilegus: or, A defensative against the plausible pest, or guilded poyson, of that nameless paper, (supposed to be the plot of Dr. C. Burges, and his partners;) which tempts the Kings Majestie by the offer of five hundred thousand pounds, to make good by an Act of Parliament to the purchasers of bishops, deans, and chapters lands, their illegal bargain, for ninety nine years. By John Gauden, D.D. chaplain in ordinary to the Kings most excellent Majesty.
titleStmt.author: Gauden, John, 1605-1662.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by J.B. for Andrew Crook, at the sign of the Green-Dragon in St. Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: A reply to: Burges, Cornelius. A case concerning the buying of bishops lands.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
